original_title: Want Lower Power? Add More Cores!
original_content:
[Jacob Beningo] over at Embedded.com recently posted his thoughts on how to do a low-power microcontroller design. On the surface, some of his advice seems a little counter-intuitive. Even he admits, Im suggesting adding more cores! I must be crazy! There are a few tips, but the part hes talking about is that you can save power by using CPUs with multiple cores and optimizing for speed.
This seems strange since you think of additional cores and speed to consume more power. But the idea is that the faster you get your work done, the faster you can go to sleep. Weve seen that in our own projects  faster work means more napping, and thats good for power consumption.
Of course, it isnt just that simple. Multiple cores dont help you if you dont use them. The overarching goal is to get done quickly so you can get back to sleep. You know, kind of like work. The other advice in the post is generally good, too. Measure your power consumption, respond to events, and  maybe slightly surprising  with modern CPUs, variations within the CPU family, according to [Jacob], isnt very significant. Instead, he reports that the big changes are switching to the least-capable processor family.
Naturally, Hackaday readers are no strangers to low-power design. If you get your power consumption low enough, you can consider a low-tech battery or even a potato.
title: 多数のコアで速度を最適化し、省電力マイコンの設計を実現
body: 多核CPUを使うことで省電力化ができるという記事。作業をより迅速に行うことでスリープモードに移行し、消費電力を削減できる。また、CPUファミリー間の消費電力差はわずかであるため、最も低性能なプロセッサーを選択すれば省電力化ができる。
titles: 多数のコアで速度を最適化し、省電力マイコンの設計を実現
電力消費を測定してイベントに応答するという省電力設計のヒント
速度が速いほどスリープ状態に移行でき、省エネにつながる
現代のCPUでは、CPUファミリー内でのバリエーションはあまり重要でない
低消費電力設計をすれば、低コストなバッテリーやジャガイモを使用可能
